head.p: to: Mr. Rump school district, Texas from: John Smith school in Cologne, NRW 8th of December 2021

p.s: I recently read the novel The Hate U Give by Angie Thomas which seems to be banned in your school.
The reasons given are the language used in the book and the sexual references.
But I believe those are invalid reasons to ban a book it they are just as minor as they are in this novel.
The only real sexual references are situations where one wants to do it and the other does not.

And because the person who wanted to do it accepts this decision it is totally acceptable to put these scenes in a book because it is really important to know that you have to respect each other in a relationship like that.

I can understand why you and others might be offended or irritated by the offensive and sometimes vulgar language but I think it is not reasonable to ban a book for language as minor as in this novel.
But the most important aspect is the subject of racism that is described beautyfullybeautifully in this novel.
The struggles prejudices and differences can be understood by everyone and I think it is important to at least understand why and how black people feel so we can change the world for the better.
I do not necessarily want to call you a racist but you would definitely show that you are not a racist if you would allow the book in the library of your school.

I also think that we should show and tell the children not only in America but worldwide what the problems of our society are so they do not even start to ignore them and this novel is a beautyfulbeautiful way of doing this.
In a Nutshellnutshell I would recommend allowing this novel not only because of the theme but also because it is a very well written book.
